title: Man charged for allegedly shooting, killing 16-year-old nephew
content:
A 48-year-old Detroit man has been charged for his alleged role in the shooting death of his 16-year-old nephew.
According to Wayne County Prosecutor Kym Worthy's office, James Lee Graham and his nephew, Freeland Pridgen, got into an argument Friday afternoon, Nov. 25 in the 9100 block of Ward in Detroit. During Graham and Pridgen's argument, it is alleged that the 48-year-old went into another room to retrieve a shotgun and it discharged, striking the 16-year-old.
Pridgen died the following day at the hospital. The Detroit Police Department reports that the victim was struck in the body.
After the shooting, Graham is said to have escaped the scene in a pickup truck before being apprehended.
Graham is charged with open murder, which allows a judge or jury to decide on the degree of murder or manslaughter if the defendant is convicted. He was arraigned on his charges in 36th District Court, and has a probable cause conference set for 8:30 a.m. Dec. 7, and preliminary examination for 9 a.m. Dec. 13.
Both the conference and hearings are scheduled before District Court Judge Shannon Holmes.
